content:
I apologize if my previous responses were not helpful or if they caused any confusion. It was not my intention to repeat the same concepts or to not understand your follow-up questions.

To clarify, the difference in the range of the examples I provided in the two questions was due to the different criteria and contexts of the questions. In the first question, the criteria were that the cities must be located approximately 921 miles from New York City and experience snow in the winter, which allowed for a wider range of options because the criteria were not as specific as the criteria in the second question. In the second question, the criteria were that the numbers must be close to the number 921, which resulted in a narrower range of options because the criteria were more specific.

The general difference between the two contexts that led to the difference in the range of answers is that the criteria in the first question were not as specific as the criteria in the second question. The term "approximately" implies that the quantity in question is not precise, but is close to a certain value. In the first question, the criteria for the cities were that they must be located approximately 921 miles from New York City and experience snow in the winter, which allows for a wider range of options because the distance from New York City and the presence of snow in the winter are not precise, but are close to certain values. In the second question, the criteria for the numbers were that they must be close to the number 921, which results in a narrower range of options because the criterion of being close to the number 921 is more specific.

I hope this helps to clarify the difference in the range of the examples I provided in the two questions. Please let me know if you have any
